config.question: Why did Virginia decide to cede its holdings north of the Ohio River to the Confederation?

choices.content: It was difficult to govern such a large territory from Virginia’s capital.
Virginia had formed an agreement with Connecticut to share the powers.
Virginia had obtained a charter before independence and this invalidated its claim.
Virginia was offered another portion of land near the Pacific coast.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Virginia was the first state to cede the holdings. These transfers established an important principle. After 1781, it was agreed that the West belonged not to the separate states but to the United States. See L.O. 6.2 Why did many Americans regard the Articles of Confederation as inadequate?
